intro: Xylacanthus laoticus, commonly known as the Laotian woodspore, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Laos. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant has woody stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
